Reviews.Title: “Why would anyone stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: jcbuzzman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got home from a stay in Branson at the Boxcar Willie Inn. What a wonderful hotel. We had a queen size room with a great view (Room 301). Could the hotel use some updating? Sure, but I cant remember the last time we stayed in a place that was this clean. The staff was fantastic. When we checked in the lady at the desk was super friendly and had us checked in super fast. When I asked her about tickets to shows, she turned us on to Terry's Tickets. You call a number and talk to Terry and order your tickets at a very steep discount. You can pay over the phone with a credit card or leave cash at the front desk. The tickets then are delivered to the front desk at the hotel! He got us the best seats and even got us aisle seats which I like. The only thing that I wish they had were keyless doors on the room. They still use old fashioned keys on the plastic key ring. The hotel is right off the strip so it is very convenient but also nice and quiet. It was our first trip to Branson and we had a ball!! We will be back and we will stay at the Boxcar Willie Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: HagoodReunion
Reviews.Content: Our 3 day family reunion for 40 was held at Boxcar Willie Inn. The meeting room with a full kitchen worked very well for us as we bring food for our meals. The hotel staff went the extra mile to make our stay pleasant. Some of our group liked being near the strip yet it is on a quiet street. This is an older hotel but is very clean. My only complaint would be that breakfast was adequate...not the best. Some family thought the pool was cool when we arrived but staff overheard them and turned the temperature up. We will definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Teenage dance troup adventure”
Reviews.Author: Tawni P
Reviews.Content: Hi would like to thank ALL of the employees of the the Boxcar Willie Inn. We received superior service and respect. The staff bent over backwards for us. We had 15 teenage dancers that performed in multiple shows. They were clowns and wore white make up. The employees provided extra towels and extended our clean and check out times to accomodate our needs. If you asked, it happened and employees always had a smile on their face and said helllo. Boxcar is off the main back road so it is quiet, but connect right to the secondary, less traveled road so you can get anywhere without having to drive down the strip every time. Thank you Boxcar Willie staff. I will be back!! 100% excellent reveiw from Debs School of Dance, Dexter, Iowa

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bang for the buck!”
Reviews.Author: Susandm
Reviews.Content: Low rates, very clean rooms, super friendly staff, with an awesome breakfast. We had one issue with some neighbor, so I reported the issue, and they totally made it right. It is off the main strip, but still close to everything. Will stay here again (and again)!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled!”
Reviews.Author: Robin P
Reviews.Content: July 2012. I cannot fathom how this hotel has such good reviews, which is why we stayed there. The only good thing I can say is, the room was clean & spacious. It then goes downhill. This place has seen better days. The exterior is run down, the lobby and room decor is very outdated/old, and the free breakfast was horrible. The eating area was filthy, the selection poor, the cook was gross, and the food was terrible. Not a snob or trying to be rude, just calling it like I see it. Depending upon when you're visiting Branson, you might be better off finding a hotel when you arrive, as many of the hotels looked run down when you see them in person. I probably would not stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: grtmom
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at the Boxcar Willie. The staff was extremely sweet and friendly. My room was very clean and comfortable. The location is great. Just far enough off the strip for a peaceful nights sleep. The breakfast is basic, but they do have cooked waffles, which is all my daughter wanted anyway. If you want fancy, stay somewhere else. If you want a clean, simple place to stay with exceptional staff that is inexpensive, come here. Lets face it, all you need a room for in Branson is to sleep, nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel very reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: Mitchell L
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. Clean rooms, Great breakfast, but most of all the staff was great. Kind of off the main drag but thats what I like. Nice and quiet. Iryna and Mary at the front desk were especially hospitable and friendly. This was my third time to stay here and I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jessica B
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here with my family. We did not have a reservation. The room was inexpensive and the staff was friendly. Nice indoor pool and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: mariannefarrar
Reviews.Content: i booked this room over an Internet agency from Branson. To show you how crooked they are, they charged me 80.00 more, I was appalled. This had been our first time i Branson. Needless to say the Hotel was nothing like the add said. The beds are terrible outdated. Mattress had been sunken in. The blinds on the window had been damaged, people could look in our room. The rooms are clean, yet outdated. The food..hmm, shall I say the Health department needs to take a look at it, seriously. Flies everywhere, the guy who fixed the breakfast , had been scratching himself and had a nasty shirt on, the milk was spoiled, I could go on and on. I complained, the lady at the front desk was courteous, called the owners who came and spoke with me. I did get my refund, cancelled the next night. Never stay there again,a nightmare! Indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there....”
Reviews.Author: jv2275
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there for 5 years, just got back from a horrible 3 nights stay. The place is loud with kids running until all hours of the nights. Dogs running everywhere, dog waste in the grass all over the place. Rooms are not clean, bath-tub drain broken, toilet runs all the time, the water makes a horrible loud noise while running. The place is turning into nothing but a dump. We loved staying there until now. It has been taken over by new people, they are letting it go to waste. Don't waste your time, book at another hotel.... We will from now on...

Reviews.Title: “Forget the Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Denise M
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonaby prced hotel with a full breakfast. The rooms were fine and the staff were pleasant, but the pool was freezing cold and not in the best shape. The biggest disappointment was the breakfast. What a disaster! The set up is very clumsy - trying to maneuver around the tables, which were too close together to start with, was rdiculous. There was a man heating up precooked sausage and scrambled egg patties, and you had to ask what was available, which turned out to be tiny biscuits that tasted like cardboard, unsliced muffins, and some tiny donuts (these were the same ones during our four day stay - not fresh). He would also make you a waffle if you asked. There was a self-serve area with corn flakes and milk, and they had coffee, tea, and juice. The first day the "cook" was a young man who was obviously high on something, stumbling around behind the counter. He looked dirty and sweaty and could barely speak. After we informed the staff about him, he was removed and we didn't see him again. The owners need to visit a hotel with a real full breakfast bar, to see how it should be done. Or maybe watch an episode of Hotel Impossible? They would be much better off serving some fresh breakfast pastries and beverages (that the guests could help themselves to, instead of standing in a bumblng line for), and ditching their pathetic attempts at a "full breakfast".

Reviews.Title: “Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: We have been having annual family reunions for 10 plus years. I must say the staff at Boxcar Willies were fantastic to work with. You felt like they were there for you not you for them. I cannot say that was true for the different places we have stayed over the years. As a closing note ....our family reserved Boxcar Willie for next years reunion.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Betty S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Boxcar Willie every year for approx 6 years 2 or 3 times a year. I stayed there the weekend of May 10th 2012, and should have left after the first night. When we arrived we were put in a dirty room and had to be moved. I did notice that NONE of the regular employees were anywhere in site. I ask if there were new owners and was told no. But, everything had changed it seemed. There was a lady in the lobby (I think cleaning) with her two children with her. One being a 3 month old infant and another one approx 5 years of age. The man at the front desk could not communicate with the staff because they spoke spanish. That was a clue that things had changed as well. I have a yorkie that I keep on a (LEASH) at all times. I was chased by 3 dogs during my visit, (1) being the managers dog with (NO LEASH). The utility door was left open with tools, ladders, broom and tape in the walk way of one of the halls for over 24 hours with no one in site using them. We were kept awake 2 of the 3 nights with employees children that live on site in the rooms running up and down the concrete halls until 10:30 one night. UNTIL I CALLED THE OFFICE then it stopped. Our last night of 3 nights we were kept up again with children laughing and running up and down the halls above us and on our floor until 3:00 a.m. One of our group was sitting outside the room in a chair, enjoying the early evening having some kettle corn and 2 children of employees living on site came out of their room (which was right next to us) and litterally started grabbing at her bag of popcorn and trying to jump in her lap and would not stop. She had to get up and come in the room to get away from the two children. There was several more things that was an issue on our visit but I think this is sufficent. OH one last thing, on our exit the managers wife was at the front desk in her HOUSE ROBE, yes I said robe. I was shocked to see this in a place of business. Well, you decide for yourself, I have went on enough and will NEVER RETURN to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay !!”
Reviews.Author: Gary B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Boxcar Willie Inn many times and will sure stay there again ! Hot breakfast, very friendly staff, and great rooms ! Coffee maker, hair dryer, comfortable bed & pillows plus all the other amenities you would want. It's close to the strip and they go beyond the call of duty to make sure you have a wonderful stay. Make your reservation today !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: gme153
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we have stayed at this hotel and it was wonderful. The service was excellent and the rooms were clean and well kept.The breakfast was nice it was a continental breakfast with waffles, biscuits & gravy, eggs, sausage, juice, milk, cereal, ect. They had a very nice and friendly breakfast server. I would highly recommend this hotel if you want a nice comfortable place that is not right on the strip but is easy access to the strip. They also had a great rate for everything you get.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff.. we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: MayviewNik
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, every member of the staff went way above and beyond friendly, helpful and kind. All the amenities you want, close to the strip.. and a cute little dog too!

Reviews.Title: “2 day stay”
Reviews.Author: kskid79
Reviews.Content: I give this a very good score based on the price and the friendly desk people the first two days. The room was nothing fancy, but very comfortable..We had the top floor view of the mountains as described by other reviewers..It was worth asking for, my folks really liked the view as well. A very hard place to find, but so very quiet and peaceful. The room was clean and the bed was heaven, that was worth the whole stay. I wanted to take it home with us!! The breakfast was simply horrible, except for the waffles...but we knew this after reading other reviews, Boxcar Willies needs to change their breakfast. We ate there once and that was enough, pool area was nice.....NOT a heated pool...cold as an iceberg..hottub was too hot at the time we tried to get in and kids toys were scattered in the pool and in the hottub. The staff needs to pickup after kids go thru this area, a leggo was in the pool and you know what that feels like when you step on it!!! Clerk did say that someone had just requested the hottub be turned up before we got in..As a person who has a hottub, it takes quite awhile to get those things cooled down. If I would have had a bucket, I would have used the pool water.Still a nice place to stay, not sure if I would stay again??

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: tracy g
Reviews.Content: This was the second year I took a group of 50 to Branson and we stayed in this hotel. The staff was very accomodating and inviting. The rooms were great and we even had the use of a conference room for free. You can't beat the price or the service. This is my go to hotel in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Roxanne M
Reviews.Content: Boxcar Willie's was a great stay. Our room was clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Honestly, we ended up at Boxcar Willie's because when I initially started calling hotels they were so great on the phone. Our stay did not disappoint. If you're looking for a clean, comfortable, and affordable; this is it. Plus it's only about 2 blocks off Hwy 76.

Reviews.Title: “A great value place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rich M
Reviews.Content: Anytime we visit Branson, we always stay at Boxcar Willies. We've never experienced any problems with our stay and have found the staff amazingly helpful. We highly recommend this as a great place to stay that's not right in the middle of the main street traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Inn”
Reviews.Author: dburrowssr
Reviews.Content: This was our second year in a row we stayed at Boxcar Willie's we love the place and will never stay anywhere else its clean and very nice. Mary and Dave was so nice and they show their appreciation for there guests. We was there during the Tornado February 2012 and when the electric come back on our refridgerator did not work they had us anther fridge within 10 minutes of being told about it. The indoor pool and spa is awesome. If you are looking for a place to stay in Branson Boxcar Willie's is it you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest place we have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: mamagirl3
Reviews.Content: This is 'THE CLEANEST' place we have ever stayed in all our travels! We have stayed in some very nice places; and they were very acceptably clean.... but, i was so amazed at the cleanliness of our room after a few days... I just had to run a rag across the top of the door facing going into the bathroom.... hahahaha YEP... you guessed it! CLEAN! hahaha The only ounce of dust we were able to find was in the heater vent! And that was very minimal at very MOST! hahaha we had to really stretch to say that! The staff were all so kind! The room service was none like we have seen (other than cruises): there were NO "DO NOT DISTURB" cards! because they didnt disturb anyway! No matter what time we got up or what time we left our room.... no one ever knocked and disturbed us... yet no matter what time of day it was... when we would step out for a bit.... when we returned... our room would be SPOTLESS and SMELL SO GOOD!! the smell would hit you when you opened the door! it was GREAT!! We never had to ask for anything! There just isnt enough space to say how great our experience was. Our room had a little fireplace...not all rooms do; but if that interests you, there are some rooms with them. the corner rooms are very roomy too! not cramped at all! plenty of walking around space!

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: curatokid
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the few now open around this area and provides a good basic accommadation, the staff are very friendly and helpful, the location is just off the strip and very quiet, breakfast is as usual with cerials, egg and sausage etc all served with a friendly smile, rooms are all OK, I have stayed here several times and would stay there again on my return to Branson...

Reviews.Title: “The perfect motel experience”
Reviews.Author: Leroy J
Reviews.Content: We totally enjoyed our 3 day stay at the Boxcar Willie. The room and grounds were very clean, comfortable and cozy with every amenity. The hot breakfast had great choices and the staff were all friendly and accommodating. The location is perfect. We will definitely stay there again and highly recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “The whole experience was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: BradBurgan
Reviews.Content: We were in Branson over the New Year's weekend and stayed at the Boxcar. The staff was super friendly, the breakfast was great, the rooms were clean and tidy and we were just off the strip so we could get to any of the restaurants or attractions quickly and easily. We will definitely stay here again when we come back to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE...BOOK DIRECTLY, DONT USE THIRD PARTY”
Reviews.Author: TLove1999
Reviews.Content: Worst experience with a hotel ever! First off, we were in a room under a herd of elephants or so it sounded like. Twice, it sounded like the hotel was caving in due to an earthquake but none reported. Expedia was absolutely useless as a third party. Phoned the front desk about noise that went on the entire night. Desk clerk sounded like she was dying from smoker's cough. They did nothing to stop the noise or remedy our being disturbed. We were very tired from our 6 hour trip. The next night we wanted to get into the pool, it was green and was closed for maintenance. The desk clerk said we could use the hottub. It was green as well. The breakfast was nasty. Tasted like what I could imagine prison food tastes like. Gross! and the guy serving it is the maintenance guy with dirty black fingers. We booked this hotel because of the good reviews on tripadvisor. The rooms were out of date but clean. The elevator was really really scary dirty. The doors to the rooms use a real key instead of a key card which didn't feel very safe. The only positive thing i can say about this hotel is that the rooms are clean. There are too many nicer places for a better price with the same amenities in Branson, to waste you time, money, and good trip on this hole in the wall. Our trip was ruined!

Reviews.Title: “Some problems, but great value.”
Reviews.Author: happysmile165
Reviews.Content: Well, we enjoyed our stay overall. There were some issues with our rooms. We stayed in Dec. 2010 and our group had 2 rooms. The room I was in, the heater had no "happy medium" and was either on full blast or not at all. So we would run it for a while then shut it off. Of course, this did not happen till about 11 at night so made for a fun night's sleep. The other room had some issues, not as bad and I think they were taken care of. This was on a weekend that was bitterly cold, and the elevator also quit working and we had to walk up and down 3 flights with all our stuff to leave. But, it was clean, the pool, sauna & hot tub were big pluses. Breakfast was great and the location is awesome. The staff was friendly and the price was right. I would stay here again, but would hope for a room with a correctly working heater LOL.

Reviews.Title: “Best nights sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Holly B
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel just off the strip!! Nestled back in the woods you can not even hear the hustle and the bustle of the strip that is just beyond your door!! The rooms were clean and the beds so soft and comfortable that you didn't want to get out in the morning. The pillows were like little clouds!! Everyone that stayed in our room agreed that the pillows were excellent!!! We did not get to try out the pool because it was closed due to lighting and thunder going on but we checked it out before we left the next morning. It looked clean and the water was warm. I liked the idea that there were pool toys and floaties available to play with for the kids. Breakfast was good, just your basic style, but I don't stay at a hotel for a great breakfast. It was enough and satisfying. The service was friendly and helpful!! We have been coming to Branson for 13 years and we stay at different place every time because there hasn't been one that we care to go back to. We have finally found that place!! The price is right, the rooms clean and cozy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best”
Reviews.Author: buddymusic
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Boxcar Willie Inn about three months in the past two years and I can say unequivocally that I have never been treated better or had better service and accomodations anywhere. It is the best hotel value in Branson, MO and I highly recommend the Boxcar to everyone. The staff is wonderful! I just won't go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A Warm, Friendly, Clean, Super Accomodating Property”
Reviews.Author: royaltycoach
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a bus tour at Boxcar, I have been there before and loved it and I hoped my group would feel the same as I, they did. The staff was super and when we ran into less than acceptable restaurants the staff was quick to get our huge group into another restaurant at the last minute. I know of no other hotel that would have taken time to help us with that. The previous review spoke of a cold pool? We thought it was like bath water. Many of the properties in Branson only offer outdoor pools. We did not mind the walk, it was not cold, in fact I was barefoot between the room and the pool area. The breakfast was better than most places we have been, my only suggestion might be more fresh fruit, but otherwise quite a variety was available. I loved the view from the third floor. I loved the fact that it is just a couple blocks off the main strip but is nestled in the trees to give that Ozark Mountain feel. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Branson Missouri”
Reviews.Author: Denstu
Reviews.Content: The advertising of the hotel stated large indoor pool which was correct. BUT the pool is located in another building from the rooms. We went in the Late Fall/Early Winter.. You had to walk outside to the pool which none was enclosed, once inside the building housing the pool, the water was very cold.. So beware if traveling later in the year.. Breakfast was very disappointing...

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Branson, MO”
Reviews.Author: Andrea H
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Boxcar Willie Inn and theater. Our stay was very nice, the rooms clean, bed and pillows comfortable and the service excellent. The breakfast area was a little bit too small for the hungry crowd, but the pastrys were ftasty and the two staff people who served breakfast were friendly and helpful. Boxcar Willie is an older hotel that is owned and operated by a small American business trying to make a living. I will stay here on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “excellent for the money”
Reviews.Author: tarina h
Reviews.Content: this is a wonderful hotel. it has a good free hot breakfast in the mornings. the rooms are clean and have printed linens which i found amazing. its off the strip and very quiet and peaceful but you are minutes from all the strip has to offer. would recommend this to anyone looking for a quiet and nice place to stay. i liked the outside entrances to the rooms

Reviews.Title: “It's clean, quiet & cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline63
Reviews.Content: We have travelled to Branson for years. For those coming for the first time, u need to know that hotels here are inns & motel style. There are tonnes of places to stay & while u can find hotels with indoor hallways, 90% are motel, bedroom door to the outside type. We have stayed in several different hotels but this may be one we come back to. It was easy for us to find since we know the area. It's quiet ....very quiet down this way. But still very close to main strip. The rooms in general are clean ( I'm ignoring the dead moth on the windowsil All week ) typical room fixtures. Plenty drawer space but only 4 hangers. Coffee maker & fridge. Yes there is a tv but if want modern flat screen u won't find one. Bathroom was typical shower in bath with great water pressure. There is a hairdryer & make up remover wipes are supplied. There is an indoor pool & a sun deck with loungers & chairs. There is breakfast included ..basic pastries n cereal. Staff were welcoming when we arrived. Lots of parking. There is a coin up laundry too on the lower floor. If u want 4 star, find the Hilton or a Hampton inn for 3 star. U want cheap n clean? U found it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel & going back in October!”
Reviews.Author: anapants
Reviews.Content: As far as price goes, this place is amazing. It's a no frills hotel, but for $50 per night it's a wonderful place to stay. The indoor pool & hot tub are both clean and perfect temperatures. We had my dog with us and requested a pet room. It was very clean and didn't smell like dogs had been in the room - unlike the "Quality Inn" we stayed at the previous night. The room had a gas fireplace which I can't wait to use when we return in October. For the people on here who are giving bad reviews based on the breakfast..... give me a break. One of the best things about Branson is the breakfast buffets at over a dozen restaurants for around $6. A continental breakfast at a hotel isn't supposed to be a made to order breakfast. I didn't think the breakfast at the hotel was that great either, but that's not why I stay or don't stay at a particular hotel. The staff here are wonderful & if you have dogs, this is the perfect hotel. Each pet room has its own pet food & water dishes and your pets get a fresh homemade dog treat each day of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as I expected”
Reviews.Author: mickey2162
Reviews.Content: The breakfast wasnt what I expected. The sausage and eggs were pre frozen that you could tell they bought and simply heated up and put them in a container. I expected fresh breakfast. Not some store bought crap. The waffles were good tho. Their buiscuts were store bought and not even warm when u got them, and the gravy was cold. I stayed 3 nights and each morning they were like this. Great donuts! Flies were everywere in the eating area. The cups that were used to coffe, milk, drinks in the morning were small foam cuts. Literally 5 inches tall and barley held anything The rooms were okay. The beds and pillows were great. But the carpet wasnt clean. The maids were wonderful. Everytime I left we put the maid service sign up on our door and we came back to new clean towels, more soap, shampoo. They even had shower caps and makeup remover wipes which I have never seen a hotel offer before. Coffee pot in the room was small and the blends provided were okay. Mini fridge was wayy to 'mini' for convienence. The lobby was great and neat. The indoor 'heated' pool was as cold as an outdoor hose. I couldnt even get my 9 month old son in the water. It was so chilly I thought he would turn blue. The 'sauna' fits 1 person and you dont really get any privacy. Its out in the open by the pool and hot tub. The hot tub that i thought was gonna be neat kinda smelled like pee. And was also very small. Overall It wasnt what i expected. I thought it was going to be a great place but it wasnt bad. It could have been better. But its not good enough for the price you pay, unless you order rooms on priceline and save up to 100 dollars a night.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: polishprince07
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful. The rooms were very clean. The beds were the most comfortable we've slept in in a hotel. The service was excellent and everyone was friendly and willing to help in anyway they could. The breakfast was always hot and fresh and scott was great and very good at his job. We will go back to branson again and we for sure will stay at BoxCar Wille Hotel. We recommend it to anyone who visits Branson. Just make sure you call for directions when you get into Branson-its a little hard to find at first. but thats because its in a perfect area- far enough away yet close enough to all the attractions and the strip yet quiet and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “BoxCar is ok”
Reviews.Author: cinnamon21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August of 2011. The hotel is older & I think the website shows this to be a bit better than it is. That being said, it is a clean hotel & the breakfast is not bad at all for the price that you pay. Plenty of towels in the bathroom. The beds are very comfortable. It does have an indoor swimming pool that quite a few people seemed to enjoy. The time that we were there the weather temperature was really hot & so it was just too hot for us to enjoy Branson.....too hot to walk on the strip or even to sit outside our room in the chairs that are provided by the hotel. I think for the price that this hotel has, that is is an ok deal.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 star....”
Reviews.Author: Dnicholson
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a fine hotel, it was clean and the beds okay. It is a motel not an Inn, it has outside access. The hotel interior is extremely outdated, and the rooms look like they are stuck in the 80s. The location was great it was off the strip so you could bypass a lot of the traffic. It was a fine hotel but I was disappointed in its 3 star rating. It should be a 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pet friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DNA013
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and didn't smell of any past pet usage. Good location to get around to the other different routes. Room was alittle outdated, but was worth the money we paid. The breakfast that was offered was OK for us, we went to it once out of the 3 days that we stayed. Terry's Transportations, (who the hotel recommends) helped us with 3 show tickets and saved us some money and delivered the tickets to us.

Reviews.Title: “Super Property, Great Customer Service! Felt Right at Home!”
Reviews.Author: royaltycoach
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in we felt welcome. The rooms are very, very nice. The beds very comfortable and super pillows! The front desk people are warm and welcoming. The property is clean and nestled in the woods but right on the road, very nice. Loved the pool, the complimentary breakfast. I could live here!

Reviews.Title: “honesty pays!!!”
Reviews.Author: jazeeeeee53
Reviews.Content: we think this is now going to be our only hotel in branson.we took our twin 3 year old grandkids with us they are a handful one day i changed purses and in doing so left a thousand dollars in cash on the vanity it is our emergency money I didnt realize it till we were in a park and went to change the kids. when we got back i was sickened to find that our room had already been cleaned, but our housekeeper Maria had picked up our money to clean around it and put it back in the general area!!!it could have easily been taken and i would have had no proof so we will always stay there and the hot breakfast is not bad either!

Reviews.Title: “30 Years of going to Branson and this is my FAVORITE MOTEL!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ann_Bash
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Boxcar Willie Inn and I will never stay anywhere else ever again!!! The rooms are VERY nice, the pool is wonderful, the free breakfast is great and I've never met such kind people as the ones that run this motel. They were so sweet to give us a great deal on our room rate since I volunteered with the Joplin tornado relief effort. We took one of the tornado survivors on vacation with us and the special treatment she received from the staff at the front desk (especially the manager!!!!) was wonderful! I've been coming to Branson since I was a child and continue to visit at least once a year. I have stayed at MANY different motels, but this one will be the only one I ever stay at in the future!!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: myzrx1200
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The staff seemed friendly and resolved issues. They offer a good breakfast, though the dining area was crowded. Overall, a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: SummitLizard
Reviews.Content: Staff here is absolutely wonderful. The check-in/check-out was speedy and efficient. The room was very cozy and spacious. Full dresser, armoire, and artificial fireplace. The small table was great for paperwork and snacks/breakfast. Coffeemaker, refrigerator, hair dryer, iron and ironing board all inside room. Did not try pool or hot tub. It was cold and rainy when we went. Lobby is very pleasant. Pets allowed. We would have brought our dog if we knew. It can be hard to find because it is off the beaten path, but that is part of what makes it great. You don't have to fight the Branson traffic. Breakfast needs some work. I stood and observed for a minute before deciding that I better not get anything that needed cooking or preparation. While the man attending the breakfast area is very courteous, the layout of it is poor. It is too small for the amount of traffic that comes through. And it is very, very cluttery. I think what they need to do is close off a portion of it, get some nice, decent serving platters/containers, and a few other upgrades. Again, I would not feel comfortable with something that had to be cooked or prepared for me. Next time, I would probably bring my own light breakfast items and stash them in the fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for groups. Very accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: casajenn
Reviews.Content: Had two baseball teams stay for tournament weekend. It was a great place to let the boys play and relax between games. Had a wonderful team cook-out by the pool. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Will call them first next time we're headed to win another tournament.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in branson”
Reviews.Author: cricket4202
Reviews.Content: when the kids know i am making plans to go to branson they beg me to make sure we stay at boxcar willie, we love it there. the staff is great and want to make sure their guests have the best time possible. we are at peace when we stay here and i guarantee we will only stay at boxcar willie everytime we come to branson. and the kids love the indoor pool and the many options they have for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Branson Inn!”
Reviews.Author: KarieJ
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at three great hotels in Branson, but this one was my very favorite, and I have already made my next reservation. The hotel is not on the main strip and we had a little trouble finding it after midnight, in the dark and rain, but once we found it, everything was great! They had already closed for the night, but the manager cheerfully came down to check us in. The room was inexpensive, and it had updated decor. The beds were so comfortable! The breakfast wasn't luxurious, but it was better than most continental breakfasts. They had sausage patties and egg patties cooked to order, as well as waffles. I would not hesitate to recommend this inn! There is an elevator, too. There was also a great pool and hot tub, and refrigerator in the room. PS. It's off the strip, but very close to the strip, so that's not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Highly over rated”
Reviews.Author: averagetraveler_45
Reviews.Content: Box Car Willie's was average. Pool was nice. Sauna was small. Rooms were okay, but dated. Bathroom door was very squeaky. Breakfast needs to be rethought. Serving area too small for the amount of diners. Breakfast was not handled with current food safety guidelines. No front desk staff after Midnight, unless there was an emergency. Lobby area locked until 7:00am. Check in/out was easy. Nice that it was off the "main drag" of Branson.

Reviews.Title: “The Manager, Mary Lawrence is an Angel !!!”
Reviews.Author: dimaynard
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had previous reservations at a Motel in Branson. When we arrived at the motel, we were devastated !! The carpet had hugh stains on it and the box springs had blood on one of them. We called the manager and he couldn't have cared less. We went to Boxcar Willies and the place was beautiful. The Manager, Mary Lawrence was soooo caring when we told her and she put us in rooms right away. She felt so bad because we were going thru so much agony, that if we could have left Branson we would have. The rooms and Motel itself was wonderful and very clean!!! But Marys staff loves her and made us all very comfortable. Thanks to All at Boxcar Willies !!! God Bless You. Diana Mayanrd

Reviews.Title: “It can't get any better than this”
Reviews.Author: buddymusic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boxcar Willie Inn for seven days on a business trip to Branson and just as I have found in the past...It can't get any better than this! It is rare indeed to find a hotel that is incredibly convenient to everything and has such a friendly, caring, service oriented staff. The rooms are always spotless and well stocked with everything I always forget to bring. The free breakfast is always served with speed and with a great big smile. I have to stay in hotels a great deal and most are pretty adequate but the Boxcar Willie Inn always is above and beyond the call of duty. You can pay more. You can pay less. But you won't find a better value or greater hospitality anywhere. These people are always genuinely happy to have you as a guest and they prove it with down home friendly service and care.

Reviews.Title: “We could not have been more satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: 2busybells
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel which had an indoor pool for the grandsons and this one was perfect! We rented 3 rooms because we hosted our 2 grown children and their families and wanted them to be happy with our choice. They agreed that it was more than we could have expected! A wonderful "continental" breakfast which rivaled any restaurant! A VERY nice, accommodating man named Scott cooks up the sausages and eggs....just tell him how many and he serves them hot from the griddle! Gravy, biscuits, toast, doughnuts & rolls, waffle making available as well as cereals, juice, coffee, etc also on the menu. This hotel has more breakfast seating available than many I have been to. The manager & desk clerks were nice and accommodating also. The beds were very comfortable, the carpet appeared new, the plumbing worked fine and everything was clean and in good shape! It was a very good value for the price. The pool room also had a hot tub and a sauna! Boxcar Willie has an Inn that he can be proud of!! Oh, ...Scott & the staff are good at recommending good restaurants in the area!! Thanks Scott!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: stuandamanda7
Reviews.Content: A GREAT value. Looking for an inexpensive, but nice, hotel to stay at, we stumbled across Boxcar Willie's online. It turned out to be an excellent choice. The value is unbelievable. The hotel is not fancy. Very "average" rooms. Very clean and comfortable, but not fancy. The staff is exceptional. Very friendly. Very helpful. The continental breakfast is a hot breakfast. The food is great, and the service is amazing. The rooms are your average hotel room. Same size and amenities as most we've stayed at. The pool is very good sized. Would very comfortably hold several families. It's in a separate building from the rooms, but the buildings are side by side. You don't have to walk far to get to it. The only disappointment was the wifi. They do provide complimentary wifi...but it's not the most reliable. Definitely the best value we've discovered in Branson. We will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant choice hotel”
Reviews.Author: curatokid
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in a quiet area about a mile from main strip, rooms excellent but one very important tip, when you leave your room ( which has outdoor corridors ) make sure that you turn around and lock the door with your key as it just shuts and does not lock , we only found out by accident when someone opened our door by mistake when we were in the room which is rather worrying, did discuss it with reception who agreed there should be a notice on the inside of door to inform guests of this.... Overall a good hotel at a good rate makes it a positive choice, I would without doubt stay there on my next trip to Branson....

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: SandienKevin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Branson several times each year. This was our first time to stay at Boxcar Willie Inn. We dont normally bring our 2 yorkies but this time we had to. Boxcar Willies has designated rooms for pet owners. It was so nice to feel like our pets were welcome. From now on this is where we will stay with or without our dogs. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfy, the service was beyond great. I cant say enough good things about Mary the mamager. She went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed and felt at home. The breakfast was wonderful. Far better than the standard continental breakfast. We had sausage, eggs, biscuts, gravey...you name it they had it.....The entire stay far exceeded our expectations....cant wait to stay again. Thanks for everything Mary........

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: MaryAD24
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for someone who wants a good clean, comfortable room for not much money. The room had a coffee maker and refrigerator. The two queen beds were comfortable and there was an abundance of pillows. It is located off Green Mt. Dr., which is one of the alternate routes to Rt. 76, so you can get around to many of the theaters and shopping areas without having to fight the Rt. 76 traffic. The indoor pool water was a little cool for November, but it also has a jacuzzi and sauna. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Good free breakfast with waffles, biscuits and gravy, sausage, donuts, etc. Check your map very carefully, or have a local explain how to get there, because it is off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendously relaxing and worry free location”
Reviews.Author: Rideners
Reviews.Content: HOtel staff were all so friendly and accomidating to our needs. The breakfast was daily and delicious, hot gravy, sausage patties, eggs, waffles, juice, milk, coffee, donuts. The hotel has a super nice indoor heated pool, hot tub, and sauna. The view from our room was breathtaking, something hard to desribe. We will definately go back and stay at Boxcar Willie's hotel. It was such a restfull and relaxing location to enjoy natures' beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again and again.”
Reviews.Author: Springbreaker09SPI
Reviews.Content: We got home early this afternoon from our 3 day stay in Branson, MO at Boxcar Willie Inn. The front desk was awesome at check in. Very friendly! Our room was ready even though we got there earlier than expected. The room was very nice, neat, and clean. The beds were comfortable and the pillows were soft. In my opinion the rooms were good size. We had 2 queens and a rollaway bed and still had plenty of room to walk around. The drain in the sink didnt drain very fast but if you turned off the water for a few seconds it drained enough to where you could resume brushing your teeth or whatever it is you were doing. The drain in the tub didnt drain well either, we ended up having to take the drain stopper out and then it worked just worked fine. We replaced it and made sure it worked correctly before we checked out. They have a decent breakfast in the morning. They have a nice man in the breakfast area cooking eggs, sausage, and waffles in the mornings. They also have doughnuts, bagels, cereal, juice and milk. The pool area was nice and it was also clean. The hotel was pretty quiet also. I know on friday they were completely booked up and we had no complaints on noise level at all. All in all, we were very pleased with everything at Boxcar Willie's! I will book there again when we go to Branson!

Reviews.Title: “A really nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: cherriej
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Boxcar Willie's and were very pleased. The property is well maintained, the rooms are very clean and comfortable, but not fancy, and the staff is so nice and helpful. The complimentary breakfast wasn't fancy, but very well prepared and filling. There is free internet/printer in the lobby, which is very handy. They also assist you with getting tickets for the local shows. And, they have the best cable I've ever had while staying in a hotel or motel, including Vegas -- they offer a full selection of Direct TV channels.

Reviews.Title: “Do it again soon I hope!!”
Reviews.Author: Noel009
Reviews.Content: From the front desk, to the man that prepares you meal, just great!! Bed was womderful!!!!A fireplace in room!!

Reviews.Title: “Traveling with Pets”
Reviews.Author: boudica79
Reviews.Content: When traveling with pets, you run into complications. Size requirements (15# for Boxcar) and limitations of how many (2 at BoxW.)My dogs are a bit larger than that, but nothing unreasonable. I was traveling with my family to Branson for a family reunion. My family was staying at a hotel next door to this one, and THAT hotel had lied to me about being able to bring my pets, which i didnt find out till 4 days before i had to leave for this trip. After searching Bringfido.com and other websites, i called BoxCar. I Spoke with Mary, the awesome, polite, wonderful Property Manager, who helped me to stay near my family. She gave me a room close to the grasses for the dogs, and treated them with the Utmost respect. We were also greeted with a small squeaky toy and a gourmet treat for each dog. The motel is located off the main drag, and off to the rear of its street, making traffic very light, and still near to the bigger attractions. My only disappointment was the pool, and I don’t feel this is the current owners fault, nor much they can do short of major renovation. The pool at its deepest is only 4.5 feet, it’s a HUGE pool, but, very very short in depth. I found BW to be very nice. They had events, (a band played one night) I couldnt hear anything for the most part outside my room, except the occasional kid running full speed down the halls. Rooms were nicely decorated, and felt up to date. The oddest thing i noticed when i walked into my room was that.. The carpet had PADDING!? How often do you go into a budget hotel and notice a soft floor (which by the way is a sound deaden-er). The fridge was a small 1x1 Hauer Cube, and I had no microwave, which was no big deal, but would have been nice. The Beds were ULTRA comfy, i slept like a log, with the FOUR pillows per bed. Breakfast was nice, typical, of continental breakfast these days. My family all stayed at another motel which as well, used keys too, just like my hotel. I wasnt bothered by it, in fact it made my life easier, because i could just hook them to my keys and not lose them or demagnetize them all the dang time. All the pics i have seen of this PLAINLY show it is a motel, and not a hotel (hotel doors face exit into a hallway, motel doors exit to a parking lot/patio ), so please if you have confusion, then learn to do some research. My TV had 50+ channels, I’m sure the previous commenter must have just had a wonky TV because i was there at the same time as them, and had no issues. All in all, my trip was satisfying and I would stay AND recommend BW to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Boxcar Willie-ok, but probably wouldn't do it again,was turned off!”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasKatie
Reviews.Content: One of the greatest challenges we face as a "large family" is to find appropriate lodging within budget that can accommodate all of us. We are a family of 6: my husband and I, and 4 children ages 8, 7, 3, and 2. My son is autistic with obsessive compulsive tendencies when it comes to food. He chooses to have a very limited diet which is often a challenge for us. We often look for lodging with a fridge and microwave to help accommodate what things he will eat. Not to mention my 2 year old needs a special calorie drink for nutrition purposes, so the fridge helps things stay cool. While some nice hotels in Branson such as the Clarion and Hilton do offer fridges in rooms as part of the accommodations, the max per room often makes us end up getting a 2nd room which can be too pricey and splits us up. I looked high and low for accommodations that would allow 6 per room. 2 queen beds and or a pull out sofa work for us as we have the 2 and 3 yr old who are small, with a fridge and micro. AmazINN & Suites did offer rooms with 3 queen beds in one room, but they were full. We chose the Boxcar Willie Inn. They allowed 6 per room, 2 queen beds, refrigerator and micro upon request. They also serve complimentary hot breakfast. They boast of an indoor pool and newly renovated premises. The price for 2 nights was with tax $157.something. Upon arrival, I noticed that this was a MOTEL. We usually do not stay in motels. I tried to keep an open mind. The check in room was very nice. The staff was helpful. We were given actual keys to our room. Keys, not slide cards. I guess that is what motels are like. The premises did not look junky. They have an elevator that you can use outside. They have luggage carts by the elevator. When going to our room, noticed it smelt like trash around the elevators downstairs so I was a little worried. Got to the room. Nothing fancy. It smelt really “cheap”, as cheap perfume trying to mask odor or cigarette smoke, not clean. (This was a non smoking room.) Inside though, looked around and it looked clean, except for mold growing on the ceiling above the shower/bathtub area. When we turned on the TV, there were only 6 channels, not premium cable. No cartoon or kids channels. This was not good for the kids. The refrigerator sat on the floor and microwave on top of that. It was all next to the sink/bathroom area which was a turn off for me and kind of grossed me out. We used the pool. Way too much chemicals. Hurt all of our eyes. I guess it did make the pool clean though. Hot tub good. They even had a sauna. I think that this MOTEL had been renovated and was really nice, but it might be going downhill and needs a good cleaning again and freshening up. The breakfast was ok, but the guy cooking did not look like he was the cleanest person to be cooking breakfast. He looked greasy. My husband saw him scratching himself a couple times and was grossed out. The floor in the breakfast room is stained carpeting and a turn off. They did offer bagels, donuts, juice, cereals, cold biscuits you must microwave, canned tropical fruit, waffle mix to make your own waffles. Meanwhile, the greasy cook heats up on a griddle, frozen sausage patties, and frozen egg patties, and will spoon gravy over your micro waved biscuits. Good things about the Boxcar Willie was that it was close to the 76 strip, quiet, not junky, catering to families, and had a coin laundry room. Honestly, we probably won’t stay there again though as we were turned off about the first things I mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: sweepsqueen
Reviews.Content: We purchased our stay via Travelocity Secret Hotels where you don't know which hotel you have booked until you pay for it. We paid $121 for 3 nights using this program. We were not disappointed. Boxcar Willie's is very well maintained, clean and rooms were large and roomy with coffeemaker, coffee and hairdryer. Mattress appeared to be new and since this hotel is a few blocks off of Hwy. 76 (the main Branson drag), it is very quiet. Breakfast offered was filled with choices with the owner in the kitchen making made to order sandwiches. There was a pool, hot tub and small sauna available and a computer available for guests in the lobby. For this price it was truly a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Time Has Not Been Kind to Boxcar Willie”
Reviews.Author: KansasTravelnut
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty average place and needs a lot of updating. However, it offers an inexpensive option for those not wanting to spend a lot of money and still be able to have a clean room, swimming pool, and breakfast. While this hotel was economical, there are other hotels in the area that offer the same "amenities" for a similar price and are in much better shape.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for price!”
Reviews.Author: 9NUMBERS
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights and staff was super friendly. Older Hotel but has been remodeled. Has hot breakfast and indoor pool. Indoor pool open til 11pm most nights with hot tub and sauna in same area. Pool area could have been a little better lit but still nice. Very nice no frills hotel and not too far off main strip!

Reviews.Title: “Very hospitable!”
Reviews.Author: SnoopyMc
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Boxcar Willie's was wonderul! We were very impressed with our stay. Our room was very clean and fresh. Our beds were comfortable with lots of pillows. The refrigerator in our room was a nice extra. The breakfast included with our stay had a lot to choose from. The staff was very nice and eager to help. The pool area was nice with a hot tub and suana. You will enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good pick.”
Reviews.Author: aaronharmon80
Reviews.Content: Great value. Location is nice. Very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Krishay
Reviews.Content: We are traveling with a dog and they truly are pampering her. She gets a treat a day in the office. There is a very nice dog bed just for her in the room. There are porcelin bowls for her food and water on a mat. Our room has a small fridge, coffee maker and blow dryer. We are comfy cozy and have a pretty good sized room. I am so impressed with this hotel that I am writing this review and we still have 4 more nights to stay here. The staff here is incredible! Our air was making a noise and the OWNER came by within 2 minutes of our call, checked it and came back a half hour later with a new a/c unit. He took ours out and placed the new one in within 5 minutes! Everyone here is soooo nice! We have never been to Branson, but if the staff here is any indication of Branson we are going to have a great trip! MORE TO COME!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Comfortable, and pretty! Loved the beds!”
Reviews.Author: suzmab
Reviews.Content: My 14 year old son and I just spent 3 nights at Boxcar Willie. Our room was very pretty and clean and offered 2 queen beds. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I was impressed. The beds were very comfortable. After so much walking and hill climbing at Silver Dollar City and stair climbing at White Water, the beds were wonderful to come back to and collapse into at night! The breakfast was good. Not the best I ever had, but plenty was offered and just fine. One addition I would appreciate would be fresh fruit rather than, or in addition to canned. I'll stay there again. The pool area was quite large and looked great. We stayed so busy that even though we had planned to use the pool, we never got around to it. We came *home one evening and there were a lot of people in the pool. The pool is indoors and just outside that pool room you could hear no noise. That was impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Great people”
Reviews.Author: grammiesbargaintotes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boxcar Willie Inn (hotel) over the Memorial Day Weekend. They gave us their package deal which was unusual for a holiday, but I was happy. When I made reservations over the internet, I talked to Mary. She was very kind and helpful. When we arrived we talked to Terri, the owner. She was also very nice. We met her husband who was helpful too. The room was very clean and quiet. The pool was clean and convenient since it was inside and I could sit and watch my kids. I didn't have to be in the sun. Breakfast was great. The only complaint was it was a small area trying to get your food since it was a holiday weekend. They only had one waffle maker so everyone was in line waiting, but on Tuesday after the rush of the holiday, we went right in and got our breakfast. Scott that was overseeing the breakfast items was very nice and polite. We enjoyed talking to him on Tuesday when it was not so busy. We did have a little trouble finding the place but it's not that far from everything. After you are their for the first time, you have no trouble finding it and even maybe a shortcut. Thanks again to all the Boxcar Willie employees. the starkey's from Marshall Illinois

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are Very Clean....But Breakfast is Unsanitary...”
Reviews.Author: SoonerAirman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Branson for our anniversary and staying at the Boxcar Willie (BWI) was a surprise to her. We booked our hotel and shows through Branson Tourism. Unfortunately, they neglected to tell the BWI that we had 2 small dogs with us. As a result, when we arrived, they noticed we had 2 dogs (we asked for extra pillows and he came up to the room at the same time we were bringing out stuff in)! Due to allergy issues with future guests, they typically only allow dogs in certain rooms. The owner was nice enough to let us stay in the room we had with the fireplace and king-sized bed. My wife is pregnant with twins and we need the extra room!! The room was nice considering the price paid. The fireplace was romantic. The Bed Comfortable. That's about where the clean and nice ended. The next morning we went to breakfast. Apparently there was a group staying at the hotel. My wife is pregnant with twins and needed to eat. There was absolutely no control or order to the breakfast at all! People were cutting to get seconds and thirds (even though there is a 1 plate maximum) before the people in line could even get their first plate. Furthermore, the 'cook' was helping people put their plates in the trash, and then going over and turning the sausages and eggs with his bare hands!!! Disgusting! We left and ate breakfast at Cracker Barrell right up the street. I called the owner when we got back to the room to complain and he showed no remorse, nor did he apologize. He had a complete lack of interest in the situation and didn't seem to want to make it better. While I was on the phone with him, I heard him and his wife squabling in the background as I was talking. Very unprofessional! Lastly, if you come, stay to yourself and DON'T EAT THE BREAKFAST!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: loveineurope
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 3 nights and Boxcar Willie's with my parents. We really did enjoy our stay. The rooms were very clean and the bathroom was spotless. The mattresses in both of our rooms were very comfortable. My parents room had a little fireplace that was a nice touch. It was nice and quiet. The only negative thing I have to say is that the breakfast room situation was really awkward. One of the main reasons I booked there was because they serve a hot breakfast. The sausage and cheese tasted just fine but you did have to wait for a gentleman to cook it. The room was small and crowded and you felt like you were everyone's way. Other than that we were all pleased and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great as usual!”
Reviews.Author: SparkelliStarr
Reviews.Content: I read a bunch of the negative reviews on here and that sucks that people have had problems with this motel. My husband and I have stayed at this motel twice and love it! Both times we had wonderful service and great rooms! All the rooms have mini fridges which is handy for storeing left overs! The beds are soooo fluffy and soft! The rooms are always clean and I never have a problem keeping the place cold. My husband actually needed me to turn off the a/c cause we were frozen! The breakfast is always good. They have make your own waffels, sausage egg and cheese muffins or begals, donuts and cereal. I love how it is off the main drag because it is not noisy at all. The pool is great! All in all it couldn't get better!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: CardsFan4
Reviews.Content: Room was just OK, I liked that each room had a mini fridge, which is a positive. This is a motel with OUTDOOR coridors, which made getting to and from the pool a very cold adventure in March with wet shivering kids. The beds were broken down with "body ruts" in them and uncomfortable. I did, however like that the bed linens were like a comforter set and sheets like you would have in your home, rather than stiff hotel bedspreads. We could hear EVERY noise from neighboring rooms, which made it difficult to get to and stay asleep. Our kids kept waking up every time they heard something. Would not recommend or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: amandawest0
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from our 3 night/ 4 day trip to Branson, MO. When we arrived at our room we immediately noticed how clean it smelled. Not like cleaner, but just fresh. Our children enjoyed the pool and we loved the hot tub! During our stay our room was cleaned every day, it was nice to come back (even after only being gone for one hour) and finding our beds made, fresh towels, etc. The staff were all very friendly and you felt like you were just visiting family being with them. Our children loved it so much that when we pulled into our driveway, our 3 year old son Joshua cried.. he wanted to go back to our "new" house with the pool. We will be returning and we would invite everyone else to check it out as well. It may be a little off the strip, but to us that was a plus! More quiet and relaxed! Thank you for a wonderful vacation, BoxCar Willie!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased, Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: livn_laughn_lovn
Reviews.Content: My family and I really enjoyed our stay at the Box Car Willie Inn. The staff was very nice and helpful. The prices were reasonable. The heated pool and hot tub was a plus as well. The rooms were very cleaned and actually had home like comforters not the stiff ones you see in most motels. The motel is located off of the main strip which was nice because we didn't have to wait for traffic just to get out of the motel parking lot. Definitely a bonus. My son had lost his glasses there and the owner and managers were very helpful with trying to help us find them.The owner went out of his way to help us try to find them. The next morning when we were checking out he had called to check in to see if we had found them yet. He was very concerned and a big help. I would rate this motel a 9 out of 10. A strong 9 that is. I will definitely be back to stay at this motel again on our next trip to Branson. We have spent more than twice as much money on motel rooms in the past and were not as pleased as we were with the Box Car Willie Inn....I highly recommend this motel for your next Branson visit.....

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: World_Traveler0044
Reviews.Content: We had a marvelous stay in Branson, Missouri at the Boxcar Willie Inn. Our suite had an in-room Jacuzzi that was a wonderful added feature and the bed with customized settings was incredibly comfortable. The rates were reasonable and the owners, Rob and Terry Adams, were most gracious and accommodating. The Inn is located conveniently, so we explored the famous Branson Strip with ease. We have never experienced this combination of excellent customer service and beautiful surroundings. We recommend that any family traveling to Branson, spend their nights at the Boxcar Willie Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Whirlpool rooms are excellent, the king size bed is so comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Branson10
Reviews.Content: The owners and staff are very nice and helpfull, the whirlpool room in which we stayed had execellent decore, large room with excellent furniture and fire place. The king size bed is so very comfortable with pillow top and remote control to raise and lower head and feet, also has vibration, didn't want to leave. Very nice balcony with table and chairs. Location is nice back off the busy roads. Have stayed in the past and will stay again. The price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy even thought we didn't even stay there!”
Reviews.Author: TravelTalkDeborah
Reviews.Content: Despite months of planning (needed hotel with handicap accessibility for grandparents, indoor pool for young cousins, etc.) upon arrival we found out they had only booked one room (we had reserved fou and ultimately needed six). And... they were sold out.. The older employees made the younger employee who had made a mistake on our reservations take responsibility for figuring it out. Awkward. Turned into a big mess, we were put up at a very inadequate hotel (Mountain Music Inn or something like that - wouldn't recommend it either), just not happy with Boxcar Willie Inn or how they handled things. If we had not been intensely involved with every phone call this young girl made to "put us up someplace else" we would have been in a hell hole, no pool, etc. Not a good lesson for new employees when customers are the guinea pigs. The long-term impact: our extended family won't choose to meet in Branson again - just way too overcrowded, over-priced, cheesy, and unprofessional (like our hotel). BIG BEWARE: Branson is Las Vegas for Hillbillies. While they don't have casinos they have hundreds of "shows" that are either country, Christian or "tribute." City not planned and super sprawled so a half mile drive from your hotel to a restaurant can take over an hour in the traffic. Just surreal all around.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, nice. Suites are unexpectedly nice.”
Reviews.Author: Richmeister2
Reviews.Content: Ok, for the most part, this is a motel. It's a nice, clean motel. (I should note that we're not into the country music thing or the shows - we go once every other year or so for Silver Dollar City which has 3 really good roller coasters, btw). We saw the regular rooms, and they were good. Very clean. But my wife and I got what I think was one of the Orange Blossom Special rooms (description sounds like it). This was better than normal. Bathrooms are not out of the normal, but otherwise, it's good. Bed was really great. I think it was a Craftmatic Adjustable - did all kinds of stuff like goes up and down, etc. We slept like bricks. We're used to staying at the Wyndam resorts down there, so we weren't sure what to expect (all rooms were booked everywhere. This time of the year is really busy in Branson). But this really was nice. Staff was friendly. Pool and everything is clean. Breakfast is a little different than the norm. For the most part it's the same and you can get what you want - just go up and grab it. Except for the sausage and eggs. One big guys stands there cooking it and handing it out. Nice guy. Friendly. Just a different twist. Pool is clean, but at night it's dark in there. Dark blue bottom, Walls are dark brown. Lights are not bright. But it was fine. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: BrendaWilkes
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the price and the fact they accepted pets. Our daughter needed a room for her pet. We were also under the impression from reading commentary that the rooms had been recently remodeled. Ours had not been remodeled. We had ants and the carpet was stained and needed shampooing. The bed was comfortable and the price was about what you would expect for a two star hotel. Lobby was nice and breakfast adequate. We never had maid service because they always came late in the afternoon when we were getting ready for an evening out.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: Kogeecat
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a delightful trip to Branson, MO staying at Boxcar Willies. First let me tell you about the staff---they are wonderful! Very warm, friendly and helpful. They went out of their way on more than one occassion to assist us. The room- clean with very comfortable beds. The location- about 2 blocks off the main road, so nice and quiet...far enough away, yet close enough to be convenient. Value for the money--GREAT! You would think for the price it would not have been nearly as nice, but it was a wonderful surprise. We stayed for 6 nights and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleBrandy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a trip to Branson - we spent 3 nights at the Boxcar Willie Inn. We chose it because the price was fantastic and the reviews were good. We were so impressed! It's in a fairly convenient location - not on the strip but not too far away. Quiet area. Our room was newly remodeled and absolutely SPOTLESS. Bed was very comfy. There was an electric fireplace that made us wish it was colder outside! The staff was very friendly. Breakfast was good; there's a comfortable lobby to sit in and drink your coffee. The only problem we had was the wi-fi was not always accessible - we could connect but could not get to the internet for some reason. This was a sporadic problem. (We were able to connect to the next door hotel!) We do not have any immediate plans to return to Branson, but if we ever do, we'll stay here. I cannot recommend enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - some negatives, but some nice plusses, too”
Reviews.Author: TTTStLou
Reviews.Content: The review by Lid535 was about right, although the pool was clean when we swam in it. There were nice sheets and the mattress was of a pretty high quality. Four nice pillows for each bed added to the comfort. We liked the breakfast - sausage/egg/cheese and waffles along with cold staples. Service was friendly. The room furnishings were a little dated (as was the hotel overall) and the carpet stained, but it was clean enough for my wife, which is saying a lot. We found the location to be very convenient since we went to Silver Dollar City 3 times and Andy's Frozen Custard wasn't too far (a favorite). Definitely make sure and get a map in advance and undestand the alternate routes before making your way to this hotel. There should be no traffic delays if you stay off the main drag - hwy 76. Use the yellow route. If you don't have a map before you hit town, stop at one of the tourist assist locations and grab one (if they try to get you into a timeshare tour, just say no). For a 2-star hotel, I don't think you're going to find anything better. We got our room for $52.50/night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Suites, Spectacular staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lost-Dove
Reviews.Content: My husband and I choose this hotel because of all the fantastic reviews! When we checked in the girl at the front desk made everything go very smoothly, and even showed us right where our room was. They do have an elevator and since we were on the third floor it helped a ton! They even have Three (count them) ground floors which is great if your elderly or handicapped. We got one of the rooms on the back of the hotel which had an amazing view and the small electric fire place in the room added a very romantic ambiance to the setting. The beds were soft, and provided with a ton of lush pillows. It was pretty hot outside so we had the A.C working over time but it was still pretty quiet considering. The pool was VERY clean, I even saw the maintenance guy out there every day checking the levels and cleaning it. When I noticed white flecks in the pool I gathered the nerve to ask about it, turns out that was the chlorine and not some strange thing floating around. The hot tub was the perfect temperature, and we even figured out how to turn on the jets. The dry sauna was a bit difficult to figure out, but when the front desk staff saw us struggling she kindly offered her help. It does take a while to warm up (think oven) so make sure to turn it on 15 minutes at least before you want to use it. The breakfast room was pretty small, but the lobby made for a great sitting area. A gentleman even picked up playing the piano for the guests. There was a great selection of food, much better then just a roll and coffee! If you go down before 8:30 or after 9:30 it isn't as crowded and you miss most of the rush. The free wi-fi had very good speed for a free hotel internet, our computer said it was a soild 3g for the time we stayed. This is a fantastic hotel for families and romantic getaways a like! It is off the strip a few blocks, so if your a walker your near by several attractions however you will want a car to see some of the better shows. The hotel even had a shuttle service to take you to silver dollar city for a very low price!

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm”
Reviews.Author: lid535
Reviews.Content: Well, I read all the reviews at various hotels in the area, and chose this one, because they were all good. We stayed here 3 days 2 nights, last weekend before school started. When we got there, it was late because of all the traffic- do your research and get a map before you go, take the back roads since this hotel is located on the opposite end of the strip from where you get off the highway. It took us over 2 hrs to drive two miles because of the traffic. It was bad. There was no parking, but I get it, we were late getting there. We had to haul our luggage uphill from the opposite end of the hotel to get to the room. There are not enough stairs to get to the upper levels here, so if you are elderly, or have any kind of problem, or alot of luggage and kids, your in for a walk. We actually dropped our luggage off the railing while one of us caught it, because it was too far to haul it back to the car. The room was pretty large, no complaints, freezing cold air was a plus! Free wi-fi!! Beds were okay. My husbands back was killing him on the last day, but I was fine. I don't think you ever sleep that great away from home anyway. The breakfast, was laid out poorly, you couldn't get into this tiny room to have a folding table and a few things on it, and some bagels and biscuits jammed in the back corner next to an emergency exit door . A worker was trying his best to cook on a hot plate, sausage and eggs, again, he was squished back in the corner. The food wasn't bad, you just couldn't get in and out of this tiny room, with the long line of people waiting to get in there. They really need to rethink this, it took forever to get your food. We had kids waiting, as well as, everyone else. They had enough seating, out in the lobby. Maybe not so crowded in off season. The staff was very nice, no complaints- The pool....dissappointment. We went for the pool so the kids could swim. It was NOT clean. There was mystery things floating in it, my husband was really grossed out, and he and the kids only swam one time for one hour. We got the net and fished some of mystery stuff out ourselves. The water wasn't clean and it smelled. My son had goggles, but the other kids( not our kids) in the pool said the water was really burning their eyes. The pool is VERY shallow 3ft on one end and maybe 4ft. on the other. Good for young children not for adults, too shallow. If you are going for a clean room, I recommend. For the breakfast......expect a long wait, and for the pool......Glad I didn't get in it, not clean, too shallow.

Reviews.Title: “A great value”
Reviews.Author: cpns4me
Reviews.Content: We just stayed two nights here and were very impressed. We had no problem finding the hotel. The rooms were not small as other posters had indicated. The beds were wonderful, very comfortable. The pool and spa were great. The spa gets cleaned every day. They had a good "hot" breakfast. We were very happy to get such a great place for $59.95. The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Diane1611
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this motel. My husband and 12 year old son were happy with me for finding this motel. The lobby was very nice, with a large screen HDTV and two comfortable couches. Check in was quick and friendly. The indoor pool area was very clean. The deepest part of the indoor pool is only 4 1/2 feet deep, as a warning for those who prefer a pool with a deeper deep end. The pool water was cold, probably because the weather was cool this weekend. The pool floor is made of ceramic tiles and is slippery, so I would suggest wearing swimming shoes. The hot tub was very nice, though. I didn't try the sauna. Pool towels are provided by the hotel, so you don't have to bring your own. The room was very clean. The large 6 drawer dresser was great; usually, you only get a dresser with three drawers. There was a 27" TV. There was a mini fridge, a coffee maker (with coffee packages, tea packages and creamer and sugar provided) and a blow dryer. There were lots of towels. A nice 3 drawer nightstand was located between the beds. The beds weren't as comfortable as advertised, although to be fair, I have a hard time sleeping in beds that are not my own. The breakfast provided was very nice. There was cereal, bagels, donuts, and cinnamon rolls. You could also make your own Belgian waffle and get a hot breakfast sandwich (precooked sausage and scrambled eggs on an English muffin. There was also biscuits and gravy. For drinks, there was apple and orange juice, coffee and milk. What was especially nice was that all the buildings are connected by covered walkways. This is especially nice if it was raining and you needed to get to the lobby. There is an elevator to all floors and there are nice carts you can use to get your belongings to and from your room. There are ice machines and soda machines on every floor. We were in room 204 at the back of the hotel (towards Table Rock) and the view of all the trees and mountains was gorgeous. We could sit on the balcony chairs and enjoy the view. There is also a nice sun deck outside the building that the indoor pool was in. The location is also great - it's not on the Strip (busy Hwy. 76), but only 5 minutes from the Strip. We would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Boxcar Willie Inn is a fantastic place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: pinkladyds
Reviews.Content: Really nice accomadations. They have a great hot breakfast with lots of choices and it is all done fresh for you. They are very cordial and really nice to work with. The staff helped with finding how to get around town easier and where things were that we wanted to see. Rooms were very nice and very clean. Just a great place to stay. Especially if you want to be somewhere besides Hwy. 76.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: asterisque
Reviews.Content: Boxcar Willie Inn was like our home away from home. They were so friendly and helpful. The location is ideal--convenient to everything, but away enough from the center of traffic to be quiet and peaceful. The room was very comfortable; they had everything we needed. A huge pool and hot tub. Great with directions and help with getting tickets. The staff really look after you, and try to make your visit memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly people”
Reviews.Author: Page21
